result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance K Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
  Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Metro Drug Unit.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Sign Releases for Agent.

Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber.  Last 40 days STAYED-To commence at noon on 10/19/2015.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lance K Wagner in court with attorney Kevin G Keane.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1. Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Keane makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
1 year Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 day).  
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Sign Releases for Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Defendant to avoid any person or place assoicated with the sale, distrubution, or use of illegal controlled substances
Condition Time: 60 days huber, Last 40 days stayed - To commence at noon on 10/19/2015
$600.00 BUY MONEY to be paid to the Metro Drug Unit to be paid as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-12-2015 10:30 am
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
